// Program for the TENNCLUM problem
// Simple string manipulation

#include <iostream>
#include <stdio.h>
#include <cstring>

using namespace std;

int t, n;
int S, C;
int gameS, gameC;
char points[100005];

int main()
{
  scanf("%d", &t);
  while(t--)
  {
    S = C = gameS = gameC = 0;
    scanf("%d", &n);
    scanf("%s", points);

    if(points[0] == 'S') 
     gameS = 15;
    else
     gameC = 15;

    for(int i = 1; i < n; i++)
    {
      if(points[i] == 'S')
      {
        if(gameS <= 15) gameS += 15;
        else if(gameS == 30) gameS = 40;
        else { gameS = gameC = 0; S++; }
      }
      else
      {
        if(gameC <= 15) gameC += 15;
        else if(gameC == 30) gameC = 40;
        else { gameC = gameS = 0; C++; }
      }
    }

    if(gameS + gameC == 0) printf("%d-%d\n", S, C);
    else printf("%d-%d,%d-%d\n", S, C, gameS, gameC);
  }

  return 0;
}
